title: Would more people have suffered from foot odor in the distant past than today? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends how far back you go and where. First, a major cause of foot odor is shoes, especially enclosed ones rather than sandals. Second, there’s a genetic component - Japanese people have fewer sweat/scent glands than people from Africa, with most others somewhere between. And third, there’s a dietary component. So a thorough analysis would account for all of these, but i have not seen such an analysis.
